answers.answer: Hi,What is your name?The term dizziness is used by patients to describe a variety of head sensations or gait unsteadiness.Have you got feeling of light headedness?Faintness is usually described as light-headedness followed by visual blurring and postural swaying. It is a symptom of insufficient blood, oxygen, or, rarely, glucose supply to the brain.It can occur prior to a syncopal event of any etiology and with hyperventilation or hypoglycemia.I think you should be seeing a physician for evaluation and management.Are you diabetic? Do you have asthma or allergic disorder in any form?
yes, i do get a feeling of light headedness after i work out or even during, i am not diabetic and i had wheezing as a child only.

Hi,I understand that you are not diabetic, but when was last investigation for sugar status done?Have you seen any physician for your current problem?I think you should be seeing Internal Medicine Specialist and get your self investigated for Diabetes and Asthma too.You should be doing sugar status and Glycosylated hemoglobin level.For asthma you can get Spirometry test.Hope this helps you.Keep me informed regarding your decision and any queries that you have.Bye.
i had a glucose test in 11/07 and everything was normal. thank you.

question: Hi,I'm a 22yr old female, in perfect health, I joined the gym in mid december 2007 and i can't seem to do more than 10minutes on the eliptical without having a feeling of dizziness, shortness of breath and my body gets very hot. I remember when I used to work out, that I was able to do 15minutes without a problem. Is there a special breathing technique I need to learn? I don't have breathing problems otherwise and I'm just scared that this is a side effect of something more major, if anyone has an answer, please help! thank you.
title: Hot sweats, dizziness and trouble breathing
